name: Longfei Shangguan
content: Longfei Shangguan Longfei Shangguan Assistant Professor Computer Science Center for African Study (adjunct professor) University of Pittsburgh Visiting Faculty Researcher@Google I lead Pittsburgh Experimental Research Group (PERG). My group builds hardware and software systems to push the limits of computing, sensing, and communication barrier of sensor and wireless technologies. Before joining Pitt in the fall of 2022, I was a postdoctoral research associate at Princeton and later as a senior researcher at Microsoft. I earned my Ph.D. from HKUST in 2015 under Yunhao Liu and Ke Yi. My work was nominated for Best Paper Award at SenSys 2025, and was awarded Best Paper Award at MobiCom 2024, Best Paper Runner-up Award at MobiCom 2021, Distinguished Paper Award at Ubicomp 2016, and Best Paper Award at TrustCom 2014. I am a recipient of an NSF CAREER Award in 2024, a Google Research Scholar Award in 2023, and the AIoTSys Young Scientist Award in 2023. Current Project Computing - Sensor-in-the-loop AI Agent: developing personalized AI agent through multi-modal sensor technologies. Sensing - Inside-out & Outside-in: exploring various sensor modalities (acoustic, vision, and many others) for human-centric sensing. Communication - Wireless Digital Twin: understanding the wireless world through neural ray tracing.
